prompt: Provide a professional summary for Scott Lai.
completion: AI Engineer with 5+ years' experience developing production-grade generative AI and LLM solutions. Skilled in designing and optimizing scalable ML infrastructures using PyTorch, Hugging Face, and FastAPI on AWS. Experienced in building end-to-end pipelines, scalable microservices, and ETL workflows. Proven track record in cross-functional collaboration and implementing best practices in ML and data engineering.

prompt: List the technical skills of Scott Lai.
completion: Programming & Scripting: Python, Rust, Node.js, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, R, Bash, GoLang. Machine Learning & AI: ML, DL, RL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit Learn, Hugging Face, LangChain, LlamaIndex, Generative AI, LangGraph. ML Infrastructure & Optimization: LLM Serving Frameworks, ETL Pipelines, TensorRT, Deepspeed. Cloud & DevOps: AWS, GCP, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, S3, EC2. Web & API Development: Flask, Django, FastAPI. Tools & Methodologies: Git, CI/CD, DataDog, Tableau, Spark, Hadoop, OCR, Stable Diffusion, Midjourney.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at BlueberryAI.
completion: ML/AI Engineer at BlueberryAI (Dec 2024 – Present). Developed and implemented production-ready AI-driven agents and RAG models for legal analysis on AWS. Engineered optimized data pipelines using AWS and Databricks. Collaborated on legal/regulatory compliance, aligning with ML best practices. Enhanced AI models for real-time legal identification integrated into client-facing apps.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at ScholarAI.
completion: Founding ML/AI Engineer at ScholarAI (Oct 2023 – Present). Designed and deployed a production-grade RAG system with LangChain and AWS DynamoDB, improving search accuracy by 35%. Built AI document pipeline handling 10,000+ daily requests with 98% accuracy using LLMs and OCR. Optimized LLMs with 17% better performance than ChatGPT and Claude 3.5. Implemented distributed multi-agent architecture with FastAPI/React for 500+ concurrent users. Built ETL pipelines with Spark/Airflow processing 2TB+ data.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at Ember Learning.
completion: Chief Development Officer at Ember Learning (Nov 2022 – Aug 2023). Developed DeapLearning, an AI-powered tutoring platform serving 120K+ K-12 learners. Directed a 13-person team to launch tools reducing teacher workload by 60%. Architected FERPA-secure LangChain-GPT stack on AWS for 500+ concurrent users. Used RLHF tuning to improve CSAT scores and course coverage. Secured $1.2M seed funding with strategic presentations.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at Duke University.
completion: Teaching & Research Assistant (May 2023 – May 2024). Collaborated with Hugging Face on Rust Candle LLM development. Managed AWS/Azure cloud projects and led AWS Cloud Club (200+ students). Designed curricula and mentored students in AI and software development.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at Spigot, Inc.
completion: Data Scientist & ML Engineer (Nov 2022 – Aug 2023). Developed AI tools with ML/DL for operational efficiency. Conducted Big Data research in R for insights. Explored Blockchain applications in FinTech. Delivered ML-driven solutions for security and decision-making.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at IUNISPACE.
completion: Data Scientist (Jan 2020 – Dec 2021). Led team designing 12 trading algorithms earning $2M in China's A-share market. Built data intelligence platforms saving clients $50M+. Processed satellite remote sensing data for successful rocket/satellite launch. Integrated satellite imagery, GIS, and financial analytics for trading strategies.

prompt: Describe Scott Lai’s role and achievements at J.P. Morgan.
completion: Data Scientist (Jan 2018 – Jan 2020). Built predictive analytics models reducing loan defaults by 13%. Engineered ETL pipelines and automated reporting. Implemented NLP for fraud detection. Analyzed customer data for insights driving product decisions. Presented findings to stakeholders in actionable formats.

Duke University (Aug 2022 – May 2024), Master of Science in Interdisciplinary Data Science. Coursework: Statistical Modeling, Data Engineering, NLP, Machine Learning, Blockchain. University of Wisconsin-Madison (Aug 2016 – May 2018), Bachelor of Science in Statistics and Economics. Coursework: Calculus, Linear Regression, Data Visualization, Machine Learning in Python, Statistics.

prompt: Summarize a key project Scott Lai worked on at ScholarAI.
completion: Developed an AI-powered legal assistant for patent prosecution with Wilson Sonsini. Built multi-agent system using FastAPI and LangChain, integrating USPTO data for claim drafting and prior art analysis. Implemented backend handling 10,000+ documents daily with 98% OCR/LLM accuracy. Designed 4-panel UI mimicking attorney workflows. Lessons learned: avoid overfitting to single-user workflows, importance of model tuning for domain-specific writing styles, and addressing trust in AI outputs.
